Brett Kavanaugh was sworn in Saturday Night is the newest member of the U.S Supreme Court a quiet private ceremony was in stark contrast to the Senate debate that ended with the narrowest confirmation vote in nearly a century and a half as NPR's Scott Detrow reports from Capitol Hill a final vote underscored how divisive Kavanaugh's nomination became
Supreme Court confirmation votes are among the most symbolic and ritualized moments in an institution steeped in history so it was striking that senator stood at their desks and voted gay or nay they were repeatedly interrupted by protesters [noise]
Charging at arm's will restore order in the gallery
Several protesters yelled that they were the victims of sexual assault is Democrat Joe Manchin joined every Republican Lisa Murkowski in confirming Kevin ... made allegations he sexually assaulted Christine Blasey Ford
Kavanaugh denied the allegations in Republican lawmakers said sports accusation could not be backed by evidence Kevin ... will now likely turn the spot on the court once held by swing vote Anthony Kennedy into a reliably conservative seat Scott Detrow NPR News the Capitol

The food and Drug Administration has expanded approval of an H. P. V. vaccine to include people aged twenty seven through forty five as NPR's Richard Harris reports it previously been approved for children and young adults
The H ... vaccine Gardasil nine protect people from nine different types of human papillomavirus a sexually transmitted virus that can cause cervical cancer and genital warts
It's recommended for people before they become sexually active the FDA says it's quite effective than adults twenty seven to forty five years old who have not already been infected expanding the approved age range means it can be useful for adults who become sexually active with new partners later in life
The CDC says fourteen million Americans get infected with H. P. V. every year and four thousand women die from cervical cancer caused by this virus Richard Harris NPR News
Secretary of state Mike Pompeo is pledging that the Trump administration's effort to get North Korea to give up its nuclear weapons will be fully coordinated with Japan and South Korea and pale left Okie over beyond young on Sunday after meeting with Japanese prime minister Shinzo Abe's
He said to arrange a second summit between President Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong il and
The Congolese health ministry is reporting another five confirmed cases of Ebola blaming the higher is a normal daily increase on community resistance to disease response efforts
The current epidemic has seen one hundred forty confirmed cases since July the world Health Organization is warning that the epidemic has the potential to spread into for neighboring countries I'm Jim ...
NPR News in Washington
